challengeName: HeavyWater Angular 2 Document Value Extraction Application Contest - Part 2
detailedRequirements:
Welcome to the HeavyWater Angular 2 Document Value Extraction Application Contest- Part 2. As part of this project, we will build an application that allows end users to evaluate the data extracted from documents.

 

This is a First 2 Finish contest. The first submitter to meet all requirements will win the contest. Additionally, this will be a series of contests that we will run to build the application as a whole. Our client wanted to build the app in really small increments and be able to give periodic feedbacks to ensure realization of the requirements. Hence, we are running this in the F2F track and not through Code, Assembly or UI Prototype.

 

Contest Details

A physical document’s data is extracted through OCR and machine learning and this data is then formatted for viewing in the browser. This is where our client’s app enters - it allows the end user to view the document in the browser as well as the data extracted from the document.

 

Since we are building the app incrementally, we are taking this step by step and building the app one component at a time.

 

We first built a Document List page. Deploy the existing app and check it out. We are now building two additional pages as part of this contest - File Listing page and Document Details page.

 

File Listing Page

This is identical to the Document List page, except instead of listing documents, you will list files as well as documents. Update the app to have the File Listing page as the landing page. You could also instead simply update the Document Listing page to display both Files and Documents instead. The image shared in the contest forum will throw more light on this. Additionally, note how there is a grey background this time around the elements.

 

The file listing page will call an API that returns the files and when the user clicks on a file, they see the list of documents in that file. This will be displayed in the SAME PAGE itself. Note that the existing Document Listing page will no longer exist as it is merged along with the File Listing Page. Notice how that entire section splits and is displayed independently while the other elements are lightened out. Again - please check out the images in the User Story that is shared to visualize this.

 

The client has not shared the design of this page and you need to check out the design for the existing Document Listing page and improvise. We understand that the dimensions may not match the ones expected and we will allow submissions with a reasonable deviation.

 

Document Details Page

When the user clicks on a document, you will need to call an API to fetch the details of the document and then render the details.

 

We have a design for this page. However, the design has been updated slightly to show a grey background. Please first check out the design and then check out the images shared in the User Story. For all things and purposes, please use the User Story as the source of truth.

 

The User Stories will be shared in the contest forum and contain additional details that are in scope for this contest.

 

You need to make use of Angular Material to match the provided designs. You can certainly make additional adjustments to match the design / image.

 

You are expected to follow the guidelines listed in the official Angular 2 Website. We are making use of Angular CLI and you need to use that too to build your app. Make sure that ng build (with or without prod flag) works and the app can be deployed through the dist folder generated.

In case you are making use of any other libraries outside the ones mentioned in the official documentation, please first ask in the contest forum.
finalSubmissionGuidelines: Zip your code and upload it to Topcoder. Tests are not needed. The target browser is latest Google Chrome.
